title.narrative: Primary Health Care Quality Improvement Program

description.narrative: The Program Development Objective is to contribute to improving the quality of primary health care services in the Kyrgyz Republic.

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall maintain, throughout the implementation of the Program, an independent verification agent with qualificationsand experience and under term of reference acceptable to the Bank to verify the data and other evidence supporting the achievementof one or more DLIs
The Recipient, through MoF, MoH and MHIF, shall carry out the Program in accordance with the Program Operation Manual.
The Recipient, through MoH, shall furnish to the Association each Program Report not later than one month after the end of eachcalendar semester, covering the calendar semester.

title.narrative: PDO 3: Increase in drug coverage for priority conditions under the ADP, as measured by number of prescriptions reimbursed for (i) Test strips, (ii) Iron supplements and (iii) Hypertension drugs
People who have received essential health, nutrition, and population (HNP) services
Number of meetings by the Coordination Committee of the QI unit to discuss quality issues and actions (at least quarterly)
Number of PHC facilities* receiving reports from the QI Unit on their own performance with benchmarking (at least quarterly)
Number of PHC facilities* whose Quality Committee receives training on quality improvement (at least once a year)
Number of PHC facilities* that pilot a new mechanism to collect patient experience information regularly
Number of clinical guidelines revised or developed by the QI unit
Number of PHC physicians who meet requirement of credit hours for CPD to be obtained in online mode
PDO 2: Increase in the percentage of diabetic patients (type I and II) who received recommended care (an HbA1C test at least once ayear) in a public PHC facility
Number of online learning curriculum on priority conditions (including MCH, CVD, diabetes) developed and approved for use in Continuous Professional Development (CPD) online platform
Number of diabetic patients (type I and II) who received HbA1C test at least once a year in a public PHC facility
PDO 1: Increase in the percentage of pregnant women who received hemoglobin test and urine analysis for bacteriuria during the first trimester in a public PHC facility
Number of pregnant women who received hemoglobin test and urine analysis for bacteriuria during the first trimester in a public PHCfacility
Revised payment mechanism is implemented that includes pay for quality and fee-for-service for selected priority services
The SGBP is revised to improve coverage for selected priority conditions at PHC
The drugs list under the ADP program is revised to prioritize spending on evidence-based generic medications
PDO 4: A unit fully designated to quality improvement is established within the Ministry of Health and functioning
